ticket.tag: actionpack actionview activerecord errors forms helpers time_select
ticket.title: [PATCH] time_select ..., :include_blank => true
ticket.original-body:
I'm running into issues with `time_select` raising MultiparameterAssignmentErrors. It's very similar to the email quoted below (http://markmail.org/message/lkzmx2eeghmgaw7o?q=MultiparameterAssignmentErrors+rails+time_select&page=1&refer=dtrqbqz4jyqmurjq)
Hello everyone, I'm having issues with a "time" field in a model. On the view, I use a time_select helper to generate the select for this field, and since I need this field to be NULL sometimes, I include the option :include_blank => true, like this: <%= time_select 'support', 'duration', :minute_step => 15, :include_blank => true %> The problem is that when I use :include_blank, the generated select comes with the hidden fields (of year, month and day) empty, like this: : And so, when I submit the form with the time field filled, I get an ActiveRecord::MultiparameterAssignmentErrors. If I don't set the option :include_blank => true, the hidden fields for year, month and day come filled with the respective current values, which are ignored by MySQL since we're storing them in a time field, not a datetime, and the insert or update goes on fine. Is this a Rails bug (i'm using version 1.2.2) or am I doing something wrong here? Thanks, Rodrigo.
ticket.latest-body:
I'm running into issues with `time_select` raising MultiparameterAssignmentErrors. It's very similar to the email quoted below (http://markmail.org/message/lkzmx2eeghmgaw7o?q=MultiparameterAssignmentErrors+rails+time_select&page=1&refer=dtrqbqz4jyqmurjq)
Hello everyone, I'm having issues with a "time" field in a model. On the view, I use a time_select helper to generate the select for this field, and since I need this field to be NULL sometimes, I include the option :include_blank => true, like this: <%= time_select 'support', 'duration', :minute_step => 15, :include_blank => true %> The problem is that when I use :include_blank, the generated select comes with the hidden fields (of year, month and day) empty, like this: : And so, when I submit the form with the time field filled, I get an ActiveRecord::MultiparameterAssignmentErrors. If I don't set the option :include_blank => true, the hidden fields for year, month and day come filled with the respective current values, which are ignored by MySQL since we're storing them in a time field, not a datetime, and the insert or update goes on fine. Is this a Rails bug (i'm using version 1.2.2) or am I doing something wrong here? Thanks, Rodrigo.
ticket.original-body-html:
I'm running into issues with time_select raising MultiparameterAssignmentErrors. It's very similar to the email quoted below (http://markmail.org/message/lkzm...)

Hello everyone,

I'm having issues with a "time" field in a model. On the view, I use a time_select helper to generate the select for this field, and since I need this field to be NULL sometimes, I include the option :include_blank => true, like this:

<%= time_select 'support', 'duration', :minute_step => 15, :include_blank => true %>

The problem is that when I use :include_blank, the generated select comes with the hidden fields (of year, month and day) empty, like this:

 00 01 02 03 ... 21 22 23  :   00 15 30 45

And so, when I submit the form with the time field filled, I get an ActiveRecord::MultiparameterAssignmentErrors. If I don't set the option :include_blank => true, the hidden fields for year, month and day come filled with the respective current values, which are ignored by MySQL since we're storing them in a time field, not a datetime, and the insert or update goes on fine.

Is this a Rails bug (i'm using version 1.2.2) or am I doing something wrong here?

Thanks, Rodrigo.

version.body:
I'm running into issues with `time_select` raising MultiparameterAssignmentErrors. It's very similar to the email quoted below (http://markmail.org/message/lkzmx2eeghmgaw7o?q=MultiparameterAssignmentErrors+rails+time_select&page=1&refer=dtrqbqz4jyqmurjq)
Hello everyone, I'm having issues with a "time" field in a model. On the view, I use a time_select helper to generate the select for this field, and since I need this field to be NULL sometimes, I include the option :include_blank => true, like this: <%= time_select 'support', 'duration', :minute_step => 15, :include_blank => true %> The problem is that when I use :include_blank, the generated select comes with the hidden fields (of year, month and day) empty, like this: : And so, when I submit the form with the time field filled, I get an ActiveRecord::MultiparameterAssignmentErrors. If I don't set the option :include_blank => true, the hidden fields for year, month and day come filled with the respective current values, which are ignored by MySQL since we're storing them in a time field, not a datetime, and the insert or update goes on fine. Is this a Rails bug (i'm using version 1.2.2) or am I doing something wrong here? Thanks, Rodrigo.
version.body-html:
I'm running into issues with time_select raising MultiparameterAssignmentErrors. It's very similar to the email quoted below (http://markmail.org/message/lkzm...)

Hello everyone,

I'm having issues with a "time" field in a model. On the view, I use a time_select helper to generate the select for this field, and since I need this field to be NULL sometimes, I include the option :include_blank => true, like this:

<%= time_select 'support', 'duration', :minute_step => 15, :include_blank => true %>

The problem is that when I use :include_blank, the generated select comes with the hidden fields (of year, month and day) empty, like this:

00 01 02 03 21 22 23 : 00 15 30 45

And so, when I submit the form with the time field filled, I get an ActiveRecord::MultiparameterAssignmentErrors. If I don't set the option :include_blank => true, the hidden fields for year, month and day come filled with the respective current values, which are ignored by MySQL since we're storing them in a time field, not a datetime, and the insert or update goes on fine.

Is this a Rails bug (i'm using version 1.2.2) or am I doing something wrong here?

Thanks, Rodrigo.
version.tag: actionpack actionview activerecord errors forms helpers time_select
version.title: time_select ..., :include_blank => true

version.body: Here's a patch that adds a couple test cases and a fix for this problem. It's also available at http://github.com/sneakin/rails
version.body-html: Here's a patch that adds a couple test cases and a fix for this problem. It's also available at http://github.com/sneakin/rails
version.tag: actionpack actionview activerecord errors forms helpers time_select
version.title: [PATCH] time_select ..., :include_blank => true

version.body: Here's a better approach than the above. It changes ActiveRecord::Base to add the date when it does a multiparameter assignment with only the hour and minute. The above is flawed when you select a blank hour and blank minute. The [Date]Time would still be created causing 0:00 to get selected.
version.body-html: Here's a better approach than the above. It changes ActiveRecord::Base to add the date when it does a multiparameter assignment with only the hour and minute. The above is flawed when you select a blank hour and blank minute. The [Date]Time would still be created causing 0:00 to get selected.
version.tag: actionpack actionview activerecord errors forms helpers time_select
version.title: [PATCH] time_select ..., :include_blank => true

version.body: I'm having the same problem with time_select, :prompt => true
version.body-html: I'm having the same problem with time_select, :prompt => true

version.title: [PATCH] time_select ..., :include_blank => true

version.tag: actionpack actionview activerecord errors forms helpers time_select
version.title: [PATCH] time_select ..., :include_blank => true

version.body: So I'm using the twelve-hour-plugin so that's probably what's doing it.
version.body-html: So I'm using the twelve-hour-plugin so that's probably what's doing it.

version.body:
Please see ticket [4346](https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/4346 "4346") where we're still discussing this issue after 2 years. We've provided a patch with many more tests and comprehensively covers date/time/datetime issues as well as positional parameters among other issues.
Marking this as duplicate. Please provide your comments and review on #4346.
version.body-html:
Please see ticket 4346 where we're still discussing this issue after 2 years. We've provided a patch with many more tests and comprehensively covers date/time/datetime issues as well as positional parameters among other issues.

Marking this as duplicate. Please provide your comments and review on #4346.
